so......will there be biomes on other planets yet? i want my duna ice cap fluff text

Hasn't been discussed, so it doesn't seem likely.

Or, rather, it seems exactly as likely as all of the other features they haven't mentioned yet.

I'm sure they're planned but they don't have set release dates. Biomes are implemented using bitmaps and the more bitmaps the game uses the more RAM it uses, making mod users more upset as it leaves less room for their mods.
...is there enough of the 4gb ram space for biomes on every planet/moon and all the "planned features" that will eventually be stock? or will ksp be forced to go 64bit eventually?

...is there enough of the 4gb ram space for biomes on every planet/moon and all the "planned features" that will eventually be stock? or will ksp be forced to go 64bit eventually?

Adding features or expanding on them is not quite a 1+1 thing ... And biomes in specific are just a tiny set of coords/attributes, tiny in size anyway.

Then there's optimization coming in.

Aaand then here's to hoping for Unity to fix their Winx64 issues

Cheers!

...is there enough of the 4gb ram space for biomes on every planet/moon and all the "planned features" that will eventually be stock? or will ksp be forced to go 64bit eventually?

New biome maps take up a bit of RAM, but there are only 17 planets, so they aren't going to make the stock install balloon from around 1GB to over 4GB. And a round of optimizing existing textures (there are a lot of totally unnecessary 1k textures) and assets would probably help a lot to reduce the RAM load, but I wouldn't expect that anytime soon.
